data.prayer: Jesus, protect the vulnerable in Inchiri, Mauritania from the evil one.
data.verse: My prayer is not that you take them out of the world but that you protect them from the evil one.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Inchiri, Mauritania
data.section_summary: What challenges do people here face?

data.prayer: Spirit, fill the 14 believers in the state of Inchiri with tears, because God is not obeyed by those around them.
data.verse: Streams of tears flow from my eyes, for your law is not obeyed.

data.prayer: Spirit, help the disciples in the state of Inchiri to find a person of peace today, like the Philippian jailer, who heard and was immediately baptized with his whole family.
data.verse: And they spoke the word of the Lord to him and to all who were in his house. And he took them the same hour of the night and washed their wounds; and he was baptized at once, he and all his family.

data.prayer: Father, please, raise up a generation of disciples in the state of Inchiri who will make disciples who make disciples.
Jesus, I pray that all the Deaf people will remember and turn to you, Lord God. May all the Deaf people worship before you. For the kingdom of the Deaf people is yours.
God, we pray for the believers in Inchiri, Mauritania to be generous so that they would be worthy of greater investment by you.
Father, convict the 14 believers in Inchiri to be holy and righteous. Inspire them to gather in small groups for accountability and spiritual growth.

data.section_summary:
the state of Inchiri, Mauritania has a population of 11,500.

We estimate Inchiri has 14 people who might know Jesus, 18 people who might know about Jesus culturally, and 11,468 people who do not know Jesus.

This is 1 believer for every 821 neighbors who need Jesus.

data.prayer: Jesus, teach the local leaders in Inchiri, Mauritania to be humble and to serve others.
data.verse: It shall not be so among you. But whoever would be great among you must be your servant, and whoever would be first among you must be your slave, even as the Son of Man came not to be served but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.
